segment.source: Describes the requirements for declaring your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app as accessible in the Windows Store.
segment.target: Describes the requirements for declaring your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app as accessible in the Windows Store.

segment.source: Accessibility in the Store
segment.target: Accessibility in the Store

segment.source: Accessibility in the Store
segment.target: Accessibility in the Store

segment.source: Describes the requirements for declaring your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app as accessible in the Windows Store.
segment.target: Describes the requirements for declaring your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app as accessible in the Windows Store.

segment.source: While submitting your app to the Windows Store for certification, you can declare your app as accessible.
segment.target: While submitting your app to the Windows Store for certification, you can declare your app as accessible.

segment.source: Declaring your app as accessible makes it easier to discover for users who are interested in accessible apps, such as users who have visual impairments.
segment.target: Declaring your app as accessible makes it easier to discover for users who are interested in accessible apps, such as users who have visual impairments.

segment.source: Users discover accessible apps by using the Accessible filter while searching the Windows Store.
segment.target: Users discover accessible apps by using the Accessible filter while searching the Windows Store.

segment.source: Declaring your app as accessible also adds the Accessible tag to your app’s description.
segment.target: Declaring your app as accessible also adds the Accessible tag to your app’s description.

segment.source: By declaring your app as accessible, you state that it has the basic accessibility information that users need for primary scenarios using one or more of the following:
segment.target: By declaring your app as accessible, you state that it has the basic accessibility information that users need for primary scenarios using one or more of the following:

segment.source: The keyboard.
segment.target: The keyboard.

segment.source: A high contrast theme.
segment.target: A high contrast theme.

segment.source: A variable dots per inch (dpi) setting.
segment.target: A variable dots per inch (dpi) setting.

segment.source: Common assistive technology such as the Windows accessibility features, including Narrator, Magnifier, and On-Screen Keyboard.
segment.target: Common assistive technology such as the Windows accessibility features, including Narrator, Magnifier, and On-Screen Keyboard.

segment.source: You should declare your app as accessible if you built and tested it for accessibility.
segment.target: You should declare your app as accessible if you built and tested it for accessibility.

segment.source: This means that you did the following:
segment.target: This means that you did the following:

segment.source: Set all the relevant accessibility information for UI elements, including name, role, value, and so on.
segment.target: Set all the relevant accessibility information for UI elements, including name, role, value, and so on.

segment.source: Implemented full keyboard accessibility, enabling the user to:
segment.target: Implemented full keyboard accessibility, enabling the user to:

segment.source: Accomplish primary app scenarios by using only the keyboard.
segment.target: Accomplish primary app scenarios by using only the keyboard.

segment.source: Tab among UI elements in a logical order.
segment.target: Tab among UI elements in a logical order.

segment.source: Navigate among UI elements within a control by using the arrow keys.
segment.target: Navigate among UI elements within a control by using the arrow keys.

segment.source: Use keyboard shortcuts to reach primary app functionality.
segment.target: Use keyboard shortcuts to reach primary app functionality.

segment.source: Use Narrator touch gestures for Tab and arrow equivalency for devices with no keyboard.
segment.target: Use Narrator touch gestures for Tab and arrow equivalency for devices with no keyboard.

segment.source: Ensured that your app UI is visually accessible: has a minimum text contrast ratio of 4.5:1, does not rely on color alone to convey information, and so on.
segment.target: Ensured that your app UI is visually accessible: has a minimum text contrast ratio of 4.5:1, does not rely on color alone to convey information, and so on.

segment.source: Used accessibility testing tools such as Inspect and UIAVerify to verify your accessibility implementation, and resolved all priority 1 errors reported by such tools.
segment.target: Used accessibility testing tools such as Inspect and UIAVerify to verify your accessibility implementation, and resolved all priority 1 errors reported by such tools.

segment.source: Verified your app’s primary scenarios from end to end by using Narrator, Magnifier, On-Screen Keyboard, a high contrast theme, and adjusted dpi settings.
segment.target: Verified your app’s primary scenarios from end to end by using Narrator, Magnifier, On-Screen Keyboard, a high contrast theme, and adjusted dpi settings.

segment.source: See the Accessibility checklist for a review of these procedures and links to resources that will help you accomplish them.
segment.target: See the Accessibility checklist for a review of these procedures and links to resources that will help you accomplish them.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics
